Personal Website Workshop

Event Details

  • Date: April 02, 2025
  • Time: 4:00 PM – 6:00 PM
  • Location: Alden Hall, Room 101
  • Instructor: Alish Chhetri

Workshop Purpose

This workshop is designed to help participants create and publish a simple personal website using basic HTML and CSS, with optional JavaScript. The goal is to introduce core web development concepts in a clear, beginner-friendly format, and help attendees get their site live by the end of the session.

What Will Be Covered

Introduction to HTML

Understanding the structure of a webpage and learning how to add text, links, images, and sections.

Basic CSS Styling

How to style the page with colors, fonts, layout techniques, and simple visual adjustments.

Hosting with Netlify

How to upload the finished website to Netlify using the drag-and-drop method, and make it publicly accessible. We’ll also cover basic updates and custom domain setup.

Requirements for Participants

  • Visual Studio Code (code editor)
  • No prior coding experience is required

Expected Outcomes

By the end of the workshop, participants will:

  • Understand the basics of how websites are built and styled
  • Create a simple personal site with their own content
  • Successfully publish their site using Netlify
  • Gain confidence to continue learning and expanding their site

Pre-Workshop Setup

Please install the following software before attending the workshop to ensure a smooth experience:

Visual Studio Code (VSCode)

Windows

  1. Download the installer from the official VSCode website.
  2. Run the installer and follow the prompts.
  3. Install recommended extensions:
    • Open VSCode, go to the Extensions view (Ctrl+Shift+X), and search for the following:
      • “Intellicode”
      • “Intellicode API Usage Examples”
      • “Python”
      • “Jupyter”
      • “Markdown All in One”
      • “Rainbow CSV”
      • “Ruff”
    • Click “Install” for each.

Linux (Ubuntu)

  1. Download the latest .deb package from the official VSCode website.

  2. Install the .deb package using Terminal:

    sudo dpkg -i code_*.deb
sudo apt-get install -f

  3. Open VSCode and install recommended extensions:

    • Go to the Extensions view (Ctrl+Shift+X), search for the following, and click “Install”:
      • “Intellicode”
      • “Intellicode API Usage Examples”
      • “Python”
      • “Jupyter”
      • “Markdown All in One”
      • “Rainbow CSV”
      • “Ruff”

macOS

  1. Download the installer from the official VSCode website.
  2. Open the downloaded file and drag the VSCode icon into the Applications folder.
  3. Install recommended extensions:
    • Open VSCode, go to the Extensions view (Cmd+Shift+X), and search for the following:
      • “Intellicode”
      • “Intellicode API Usage Examples”
      • “Python”
      • “Jupyter”
      • “Markdown All in One”
      • “Rainbow CSV”
      • “Ruff”
    • Click “Install” for each.

Node.js and npm Installation

Node.js and npm are required to use the Netlify CLI (optional but helpful).

Windows

  1. Download the installer from the official Node.js website.

  2. Run the installer and follow the prompts (choose the LTS version).

  3. Verify the installation by opening Command Prompt and typing:

    node --version
npm --version

Linux (Ubuntu)

  1. Open Terminal and run the following commands:

    sudo apt update
sudo apt install nodejs npm

  2. Verify installation:

    node --version
npm --version

macOS

  1. Download the installer from the official Node.js website.

  2. Run the installer and follow the prompts (choose the LTS version).

  3. Verify installation by opening Terminal and typing:

    node --version
npm --version

Create a Netlify Account

  1. Go to netlify.com.
  2. Click “Sign Up” and create a free account.
  3. You can sign up using your GitHub account or email address.

Netlify CLI (Optional)

After installing Node.js and npm, you can install the Netlify CLI:

  1. Open Terminal/Command Prompt and run:

    npm install netlify-cli -g

  2. Login to your Netlify account:

    netlify login

  • CSS Basics - MDN Web Docs
